Mild; North ~14–20 °C (57–68 °F), South cooler; more fronts/rain; daylight shortens.
Safe, family-oriented society.

Supports nuclear and blended families.

High prices in Auckland; more affordable elsewhere.

State and state‑integrated schools widely available; zoning applies; low or no tuition; secular options present alongside integrated religious schools.

Inclusive laws and social acceptance.
Market-oriented with strong social welfare.

Spectacular mountains, fjords, and forests.
Earthquake risk in Wellington and Christchurch plus occasional cyclones.

Modest scenes centered in Auckland and Wellington.
Auckland/Wellington vibrant; smaller cities quieter; generally safe; earlier nights than large metros.

Slow and relaxed outside Auckland.

After five years' residence and commitment to NZ.
Among the world's least corrupt nations.
Parliamentary democracy with proportional representation.
Small but relatively tolerant communities.

Limited outside main cities; improving networks.

Niche opportunities primarily in startups.
Low violent crime; petty theft in cities.

Swimmable in summer; cooler waters in the south.
Mild maritime climate with wet winters and cool summers.

Progressive on LGBTQ and women's rights.

Open market with regulation.

Minor, occasional local issues.
